title: Synthetic Recap
body:
HOUSTON (AP) — They tried single coverage. They tried double teams. They prayed. Nothing could stop the indomitable force of Anfernee "Penny" Hardaway in a virtuoso performance for the ages.

In a gritty, defensive struggle where points were a premium, Hardaway authored a masterpiece, pouring in a staggering 42 points to single-handedly will the Orlando Magic to a 95-88 road victory over the Houston Rockets. While the final margin was seven, this was anything but a team win; this was the Penny Hardaway show, a historic night of offensive brilliance that left the Summit crowd in awe.

With the game on the line, Houston had no answer. The Rockets, led by a valiant 22-point effort from Hakeem Olajuwon, would claw to within striking distance, only to be met by another cold-blooded jumper or a fearless drive from the Magic's superstar guard. His 42 points weren't just a number; they were a statement, a relentless assault that broke the will of a championship-tested team.

The rest of the Magic roster combined for just 53 points, a testament to Hardaway's singular dominance. While Nick Anderson contributed a crucial 12 points, his role was that of a supporting actor in a one-man play.

On a night defined by defense, Penny Hardaway provided an unforgettable offensive explosion. He didn't just beat the Rockets; he transcended the game itself, delivering a performance that would be etched into the league's lore and remembered as one of the most spectacular individual efforts of the era.
